result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian M Lemens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs of the action. If not paid in full on or before 5/6/17, stay on 20 additional days of jail time will be lifted.

20 days of sentence are stayed. If Defendant pays fine and costs in full on or before 5/6/17, stay will be permanent. If Defendant fails to pay fine and costs in full on or before 5/6/17, stay will be lifted. Good time and Huber privileges granted. 60 days from sentencing date to report.
Restitution has been paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian M Lemens

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brian M Lemens in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Court imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.
Sentencing hearing on March 6, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Brian M Lemens in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 9, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial on February 28, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Brian M Lemens in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that case be set for trial (one day) and pre-trial.

Defendant Brian M Lemens in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense has received discovery, has not had a chance to review it with his client, requests date in early January.  Status conference scheduled for January 9, 2017 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Brian M Lemens in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Atty Pribyl advises of appointment by PD's office. Defense enters not guilty plea. Court admonishes Defendant to abide by Court orders, including Court times. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Attorney Matthew J Pribyl in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.

Defendant Brian M Lemens in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Atty Gerbers advises that Defendant does qualify for PD, but they don't have an attorney appointed yet. Bond continues as is.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
No contact direct or indirect with T.R. or 136 N. 3rd Avenue.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Fingerprints and photographs by Law Enforcement within 10 days.

Defendant Brian M Lemens in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant wants to contact the PD's office. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 11:15 am.
